C

Y j

n

para.p:
Suppose that the distribution of each
X j
is the standard Gaussian measure on
R
, and write

Math.text: formulae@(S _ (list@(n, theta)) = ((sum _ (j = 0)) ^ (n - 1))@(X _ j * e ^ (2 * pi * i * j * theta)) = ((sum _ (j = 0)) ^ (n - 1))@(X _ j * cosine@(2 * pi * j * theta)) + i * ((sum _ (j = 0)) ^ (n - 1))@(X _ j * sine@(2 * pi * j * theta)), formulae@(n >= 1, theta element-of T))

para.p:
Then for each
∈ θ T
, there are
Z θ
and
W θ
, each random variables with the standard Gaussian distribution, such that

Math.text: S _ (list@(n, theta)) = (n / 2) ^ (1 / 2) * Z _ theta + i * (n / 2) ^ (1 / 2) * W _ theta

para.p:
Now,
|
+
Z θ
⁢ i
W θ
|
has density
↦ t
⁢ t
e
-
/
t 2
2
, and then

Math.text: E * (absolute-value@(Z _ theta + i * W _ theta)) ^ p = 2 ^ (p / 2) * Gamma * (1 + p / 2)
E * (absolute-value@(S _ (list@(n, theta)))) ^ p = (n / 2) ^ (p / 2) * 2 ^ (p / 2) * Gamma * (1 + p / 2) = n ^ (p / 2) * Gamma * (1 + p / 2)
